intro: Savannosiphon euryphylla, commonly known as the broadleaf siphon, is a flowering plant native to the savannas of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is adapted to seasonal droughts, with deep roots that help it survive in nutrient-poor soils. The plant plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insects and small animals.
